meanings.definition: To cause to be loved or liked
meanings.sent1: Her kind smile can endear her to anyone she meets.
meanings.sent2: Puppies have a natural ability to endear themselves to people.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to endear itself by knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: His genuine compliments never fail to endear him to others.
meanings.sent5: The heartwarming story of the rescue dog will surely endear it to many.

meanings.sent1: The handmade gift was meant to endear the recipient.
meanings.sent2: Family heirlooms are often items that endear memories.
meanings.sent3: The child's attempt to endear his favorite toy with stickers made it unique.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph had a way of endearing itself to all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out teddy bear was endearing in its simplicity.

meanings.sent1: The charming melody never fails to endear itself to listeners.
meanings.sent2: Her cheerful personality can endear her to even the grumpiest of people.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy's antics only served to endear it more to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The cozy atmosphere of the cafe always manages to endear customers.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt letter truly endears the writer to the reader.
